item.description: I am a Departmental Lecturer at University of Oxford’s Department of Politics and International Relations and a Tutor at St. Hilda’s College. Currently, I am visiting Harvard University’s Institute for Quantitative Social Science. Previously, I was a PostDoc at the International Conflict Research Group at ETH Zurich. My research focuses on state building and its effects on local development and conflict, with a focus on twentieth century Africa. Furthermore, I work on ethnic politics in Africa, in particular analyzing patterns of ethnic electoral violence and favoritism.
